alert.note: Alert for Brown; Oconto; Outagamie; Shawano (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 13 at 11:28AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Wisconsin, including the following counties, Brown, Oconto, Outagamie and Shawano. * WHEN...Until 100 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1121 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with heavy rain moving through the area. Minor flooding is imminent, especially across eastern Shawano and northwest Brown Counties were up to around 3 inches of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of up to 2 inches are expected from eastern Shawano into northern Brown Counties. This will result in a continuation of minor flooding in these areas. Thus far, rainfall across the rest of the advisory area has been lighter. However, as the storms over eastern Shawano County drop southeast, minor flooding could still develop. - Some locations at risk of experiencing flooding include... Green Bay, Shawano, Pulaski, Denmark, Bellevue Town, Legend Lake, Keshena, Oneida, De Pere, Howard, Ashwaubenon, Bellevue, Allouez, Suamico, Ledgeview, Hobart, Seymour, Chase, Pittsfield and Angelica. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
